item.title: Another Red Arrows pilot killed
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

BloodRayne:

Surely ejection seats aren’t meant to work from ground level… A parachute needs x amount of space to not only deploy but also inflate?

There are ejection seats that are designed to work from ground level. But I am unsure if the BAE Hawk has ground ejection capabilities.

"ny such downward-firing system is of no use on or near the ground unless the aircraft is upside-down at the time of the ejection.

Aircraft designed for low-level use sometimes have ejection seats which fire through the canopy, as waiting for the canopy to be ejected is too slow. Many aircraft types (e.g., the BAe Hawk and the Harrier line of aircraft) use Canopy Destruct systems, which have an explosive cord (MDC - Miniature Detonation Cord or FLSC - Flexible Linear Shaped Charge) embedded within the acrylic plastic of the canopy. The MDC is initiated when the eject handle is pulled, and shatters the canopy over the seat a few milliseconds before the seat is launched. "

From [yakman <3] Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Arrows

item.title: Another Red Arrows pilot killed
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:4, topic:420985”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=523660.msg3810242#msg3810242 date=1320831856]
Is suicide still a possibility?
[/quote]
Well generally the glass canapy is destroyed JUST before the seat is fired (if thats what killed them, injuries from being pushed through the glass). Normally they’re pretty relibable. Its not a method of suicide that you would normally go for.[/quote]

It’s an odd way to kill yourself. But you’d expect that those planes are checked to the last bolts to see if there aren’t any problems that need to be fixed. Of course it’s still possible, but you’d expect the odds of an ejection caused by a technical problem to be very slim.
